title: Schools Are Closing Classrooms on Fridays. Parents Are Furious.
content: Desperate to keep teachers, some districts have turned to remote teaching for one day a week — and sometimes more. Families have been left to find child care.

title: Britain Introduces Tougher Covid Measures as Cases Surge
content: Under the so-called Plan B, people in England will be urged to work from home and will be required to show proof of vaccination to enter some venues.

more_info.byline: By Stephen Castle and Megan Specia

title: Biden Orders Federal Vehicles and Buildings to Use Renewable Energy by 2050
content: The federal government would stop buying gasoline-powered vehicles by 2035 and its buildings would be powered by wind, solar or other carbon-free electricity by 2050.

title: Ally, Member or Partner? NATO’s Long Dilemma Over Ukraine
content: NATO promised Ukraine full membership in 2008, but without explaining how or when. Putin sees that promise as an ongoing threat to Russia.

title: Jan. 6 Panel to Cite Meadows for Contempt for Defying Subpoena
content: The select committee investigating the Capitol riot said it would prepare a criminal contempt of Congress referral against Mark Meadows, who was President Donald J. Trump’s chief of staff on Jan. 6.

title: Some Jan. 6 Rioters May Use Police Brutality as a Defense
content: Half a dozen defendants in the assault on the Capitol are using video to try to make a case that they were simply protecting themselves and others. They face skepticism and an uphill legal battle.

title: Beijing Silenced Peng Shuai in 20 Minutes, Then Spent Weeks on Damage Control
content: Chinese propaganda officials have tried to shape the global discussion of the tennis player Peng Shuai’s #MeToo accusations, but their top-down strategy has largely stumbled.

more_info.byline: By Paul Mozur, Muyi Xiao, Jeff Kao and Gray Beltran

title: John Wilson Is Making the Least Predictable Show on TV
content: In the second season of “How To With John Wilson,” the documentary filmmaker shows off his penchant for mutating the mundane into the vivid and extraordinary.

des_facet: How To With John Wilson (TV Program)

title: How Tech Is Helping Poor People Get Government Aid
content: Even as the government expanded aid programs, many people faced barriers to using them. That problem is now being addressed with apps and streamlined websites.

title: The Best Actors of 2021
content: Our annual celebration of the performances that stayed with us — including Kristen Stewart, Will Smith, Ruth Negga and Benedict Cumberbatch.

title: The Sublime Spectacle of Yoko Ono Disrupting the Beatles
content: In Peter Jackson’s “The Beatles: Get Back,” Ono is a performance artist at the height of her powers.

title: A Penny for Your Squats?
content: Among 52 incentives to exercise, giving people a 9-cent award if they returned to the gym after missing a workout helped the most.

title: ‘West Side Story’ Review: In Love and War, 1957 Might Be Tonight
content: Steven Spielberg rediscovers the breathing, troubling essence of a classic, building a bold and current screen musical with no pretense to perfection.

title: The Pandemic Is Beating Putin
content: The virus has starkly revealed the limits of the president’s power.

title: Trump Won’t Let America Go. Can Democrats Pry It Away?
content: “The radicalized G.O.P. is the main anti-democratic force.”

title: I’m an E.R. Doctor in Michigan, Where Unvaccinated People Are Filling Hospital Beds
content: With every shift, I see the strain people sick with Covid-19 put on my hospital.

content: Can a new university fix academia’s problems? Or will it just create another ideological bubble?

title: The U.S. and China Should Compete on This
content: Competition between American and Chinese companies will be the real driver of decreased greenhouse gas emissions around the globe.

title: Can the Press Prevent a Trump Restoration?
content: A journalism that shades the truth  for the sake of some higher cause will  lose the trust of some of the people it’s trying to steer away from demagogy.

title: The No Good, Very Bad Truth About the Internet and Our Kids
content: Our kids are at the mercy of tech companies, with only an outdated law to protect them.

title: Pearl Harbor and the Capacity for Surprise
content: Could we avert a similar catastrophe in the future?

title: Where Have All the Grown-ups Gone?
content: Somehow, America stopped honoring responsibility.

title: ‘We Don’t Turn Into Aliens.’ Teen Girls Talk About Puberty.
content: From period pains and hip dips to bullying and catcalling, five girls talk about the trials of growing up.

title: Radical Passion is a Family Matter for Me and My 98-year-old Mom
content: She taught me that justice is more important than unity, and that unconditional love and support is a pretty sound parenting baseline.

title: 36 Years Later, the Climate Changes at This National Park Stunned Me
content: The landscape resembles frozen spinach left out on the kitchen counter too long.

title: Will My Students Ever Know a World Without School Shootings?
content: Teachers  can do only do so much to protect their students from school shootings.

title: Truth Is Elusive in Attack on a French Soccer Star
content: The assault of a top women’s player made headlines, with masked men, a metal bar and the arrest of a teammate. But weeks later, new details suggest the original story might have been wrong.

title: Americans’ Pandemic-Era ‘Excess Savings’ Are Dwindling for Many
content: The drop in cash reserves has vast implications for the working class and could dampen consumer spending, a large share of economic activity.

title: On the Banks of the Furious Congo River, a 5-Star Emporium of Ambition
content: As the clean energy revolution upends the centuries-long lock of fossil fuels on the global economy, dealmakers and hustlers converge on the Fleuve Congo Hotel.

title: Answers to Your Questions About Covid Booster Shots and Omicron
content: Alarmed by the arrival of the new variant, health officials have called for everyone who is eligible to get a booster shot.

title: Michael Steinhardt, Billionaire, Surrenders $70 Million in Stolen Relics
content: The hedge fund pioneer is barred for life from buying more antiquities. He turned over 180 stolen objects that had decorated his homes and office.

title: Ukraine, Explained
content: And why people are fearing war there.

title: Why Ukraine Matters to Vladimir Putin
content: Amid fears that Moscow is preparing for an invasion, one thing is clear: The Russian president has a singular fixation on the former Soviet republic.

title: Remembering Stephen Sondheim, Musical Theater Visionary
content: A conversation about his legacy, his engagements with pop music and whether he has any true inheritors.

title: Vote For The Best Metropolitan Diary Entry of 2021
content: We’ll have published 255 Diary entries this year by the time it ends. We need your help choosing the best. New York Times editors narrowed the field to five finalists. Now it’s up to you to vote for your favorite.

title: School District Investigates Claims of Longtime Sexual Misconduct by Teachers
content: Six teachers from Babylon High School have been placed on leave as the investigation continues and alumnae come forward with claims.

title: Can an Athlete’s Blood Enhance Brainpower?
content: Scientists who injected idle mice with blood from athletic mice found improvements in learning and memory. The findings could have implications for Alzheimer’s research and beyond.

title: India’s Top Military General Dies in Helicopter Crash
content: Gen. Bipin Rawat, who was killed along with his wife and 11 others on board, was in charge of overhauling a military that has struggled to modernize.

more_info.byline: By Suhasini Raj and Mujib Mashal

title: Elizabeth Holmes Rests Her Case in Fraud Trial
content: Lawyers must now agree on a set of jury instructions before closing arguments begin on Dec. 16.

title: Japanese Billionaire Arrives at Space Station for 12-Day Tourist Trip
content: Yusaku Maezawa, the founder of the clothing retailer Zozo, will spend 12 days in orbit with a production assistant who will document his stay.

title: The Better.com C.E.O. says he’s ‘deeply sorry’ for firing workers over Zoom.
content: Vishal Garg said in a letter to employees on Tuesday that he had failed to show “respect and appreciation” in the call, which has been widely criticized.

more_info.byline: By Derrick Bryson Taylor and Jenny Gross

title: Proposal Would Allow E.U. to Retaliate Against Economic Pressure
content: The European Commission is considering sweeping powers to impose punitive sanctions on those seeking to influence its political policies through economic pressure.

title: Pastor Leaves His Church After Appearing on HBO Drag Show
content: A United Methodist Church pastor in Indiana stepped down after performing in drag and speaking about inclusion on the show “We’re Here.”

title: Wrong Man Arrested Over Khashoggi Killing, France Says
content: The French authorities released a Saudi man who shared the name and age of a suspect in the murder of the dissident writer, saying it was a case of mistaken identity.

title: How Staying Physically Active May Protect the Aging Brain
content: Simple activities like walking boost immune cells in the brain that may help to keep memory sharp and even ward off Alzheimer’s disease.

title: How to Age Well and Stay in Your Home
content: Don’t wait for a crisis like a broken hip to modify your home.

title: Is Dancing the Kale of Exercise?
content: Research shows that dance offers a wealth of anti-aging benefits. It’s also fun.

title: How Job Stress Can Age Us
content: Long hours, disrupted sleep and constant stress can take a biological toll on newly minted doctors. Down to the level of their genes.

title: For a Longer Life, Get Moving. Even a Little.
content: Some of the greatest gains are seen when people shift from being sedentary toward ambling for even one extra hour each day.

title: Getting Married in the Metaverse
content: One couple’s recent nuptials in the virtual world known as the metaverse showcase the possibilities of having a wedding unfettered by the bounds of reality.

title: It’s a Good Time to Be Reba McEntire
content: With new music, movies and memes, the country singer has kept busy during the pandemic.

title: Safety Nets That Sustain Community
content: Grants provided support for organizations building out health initiatives, buoying Latino nonprofits and making sure New Yorkers are nourished.

title: This Creamy Fall Orzo Will Please Anyone Who Loves a Cozy Porridge
content: This hearty, meatless meal from Melissa Clark is full of tender pasta, butternut squash and lots of warming brown butter — just the thing for a blustery evening.

title: These Books Stand the (Silly, Messy, Topsy-Turvy) Test of Time
content: Mr. Men Little Miss, the children’s book series created by Roger Hargreaves, turns 50 this year.
